document_data.mainbody:
he Street of Seven Altars was a street running diagonally, northeast-by-southwest, through the Temple District in the city of Athkatla. Like the names of many streets in the temple district, the name "Seven Altars" was a remnant of its noted temples that dated back to before the 14 century DR.
The southwest end of the street connected to Aundles Walk, at the corner tavern Harfin Draether, before intersecting with Godsmoot a couple of buildings west. 
*The Crown Aflame A well-known theater.
*Harfin Draether This tavern was more well-known for its hearty meals than its selection of ale.
